sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词均含"碰撞"之意。
means: bump ： 主要指具体东西的有力碰撞，也可指碰到困难或障碍。
clash ： 指有力的或带有金属碰击声的打、敲或相互冲击。
collide ： 多指带毁坏性的猛烈相撞，也可指严重的直接冲突。
conflict ： 这个词以前可表具体东西的撞击，现在常指冲突或对立。

sentence.Network_en: What happens when the two interests collide will make a fascinating spectacle.
sentence.Network_cn: 两种利益发生冲突时将会上演一场好戏。

sentence.Network_en: The interests of the two countries collide.
The aims of the negotiators in New York again seem likely to collide with the aims of the warriors in the field.
sentence.Network_cn: 看来，纽约谈判人员的目标可能会再次与战场上勇士们的目标发生冲突。

PerfectNetExp.abs: 一段情两颗❤ 三个字 。 ... commend 称赞，委托 collide， 碰撞 cooperate 协作.
2012年六级高频词汇(1)_百度文库 ... collaborate v. 合著，合作 collide v. 相撞，碰撞 commence v. 开始.
俞敏洪六级词汇 - 豆丁网 ... colleague n. 同事,同僚 collide vi. 撞碰 ,抵触 collision n. 撞碰 , 突冲.
新概念英语第三册单词总汇　 - 豆丁网 ... wade 涉水 collide (车辆)碰撞，猛撞 slide 滑.

list.abs: 质子对撞机（Proton Collider）：一种特殊的超级武器，会发射五颗粒子光球，用反物质的湮灭原理，产生质能转换连锁反应并重创敌 …
linear charge density 线电荷密度linear collider 直线对撞机linear density 沿线密度
collectomania 收集狂collid solution 胶体溶液colliquation 溶化
collider 对撞机colliding beam 碰撞束colliding beam accelerator 对撞机

derivation.yuyuan_name: early 17th cent. (in the sense 'cause to collide'): from Latin collidere, from col- 'together' + laedere 'to strike or damage'

entry.def: If two or more moving people or objects collide, they crash into one another. If a moving person or object collides with a person or object that is not moving, they crash into them.

example.ex: Two trains collided head-on in north-eastern Germany early this morning...
example.tran: 今天早上德国东北部两列火车迎面相撞。

example.ex: Racing up the stairs, he almost collided with Daisy...
example.tran: 他飞奔上楼，差点撞到黛西。

entry.def: If the aims, opinions, or interests of one person or group collide with those of another person or group, they are very different from each other and are therefore opposed.

example.ex: The aims of the negotiators in New York again seem likely to collide with the aims of the warriors in the field...
example.tran: 看来，纽约谈判人员的目标可能会再次与战场上勇士们的目标发生冲突。

example.ex: In the next two years, Nasser regularly collided with the different Western powers, who refused to arm him...
example.tran: 随后的两年里，纳赛尔不断与拒绝为他提供武器装备的几个西方大国发生冲突。

means.word_mean: 2. be incompatible; be or come into conflict;

auth_sentence.content: If I do I shall collide with my keyboard.
auth_sentence.res_content: If I do I shall collide with my keyboard.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: If I do I shall collide with my keyboard.

auth_sentence.content: When both collide, the amounts involved are eye-watering.
auth_sentence.res_content: When both collide, the amounts involved are eye-watering.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: When both collide, the amounts involved are eye-watering.

auth_sentence.content: When protons collide in the LHC, they disintegrate.
auth_sentence.res_content: When protons collide in the LHC, they disintegrate.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: When protons collide in the LHC, they disintegrate.

Sentence.sentence: Drivers routinely collide with deer and there are so many dead bodies left by the side of the road that the town has made it a deal with a local pet cemetery to collect and dispose of the bodies.

sentences.en: The ships collided in the fog.

means.word_mean: (人、意见等 )冲突, 抵触, 不一致

sentences.en: The interests of the two countries collide.

jushi.english: The ships collided in the fog.
The boat collided against a rock.
Their minds were constantly colliding in endless arguments.
jushi.chinese: 他们在思想上经常产生矛盾,不断发生争论。
